title: originTabId type safety pattern
details: Browser tab IDs in Firefox/Chrome are always positive integers (>= 1). When comparing originTabId values from storage, always normalize them using normalizeOriginTabId() which uses Number() casting and Number.isInteger() validation. String "1" === 1 evaluates to false in strict equality, causing silent ownership validation failures. The normalizeOriginTabId() function in src/utils/storage-utils.js converts string representations back to numbers and logs type conversions for debugging.
